arts.ttl: “We wanted to dominate this game” - Farke hails Leeds’ clinical edge after Wolves win
arts.sum: Daniel Farke was delighted with the way his Leeds United side responded to an early setback at Molineux, producing a ruthless first-half performance to claim a 3-1 win over Wolves. A lovely free-kick from Anton Stach and Noah Okafor’s tidy finish sealed the turnaround before the break, with Leeds showing huge resilience defensively in the second half to seal the win.

arts.ttl: Wolves remain winless as Leeds come from behind to secure victory
arts.sum: Wolves stay bottom of the Premier League and remain without a win from their first five matches after losing 3-1 at home to Leeds, despite taking an early lead at Molineux.

arts.ttl: Wolves fans are all saying the same thing about Fer Lopez after his first Premier League start vs Leeds
arts.sum: Dave Edwards recently heaped praise on Fer Lopez for his off-the-ball intelligence, and Wolves fans have since taken to social media to rave about his brilliant first-half display against Leeds. Fer Lopez finally made his first Premier League start for Wolves in the clash against Leeds, and he wasted no time making an impression.

arts.ttl: ”We know what to do” – Daniel Farke tells fans that Leeds United have one focus after a huge 3-1 victory over Wolves
arts.sum: Leeds United fans will be boosted by the huge win away from home at the Molineux. The club’s form on the road has not been the best since the start of the season, but that run looks to be over. arts.ttl: Leeds United already have two injury doubts after 3-1 win over Wolves
arts.sum: Leeds United are in good spirits after recording their first away win of the season. Some would say the result was coming after what happened last week against Fulham. The Whites dominated the game for the first hour and should have taken the lead, but the overall finishing in the game was poor. arts.ttl: Leeds United broke remarkable 2-year record after just 45 minutes vs Wolves
arts.sum: There was a lot of negativity surrounding Leeds United after the loss to Fulham. The Whites had a bit of optimism returning from the international break, but the trip to London was a setback. Leeds went into the Wolves game under a bit of pressure. arts.ttl: “I shut them up!” – Calvert-Lewin scores first Leeds goal to silence Wolves fans in huge 3-1 Win
arts.sum: Leeds United forward Dominic Calvert-Lewin scored his first goal for the club in their 3-1 win over Wolves at Molineux. The England striker answered some of his critics back with the sumptuous goal, and some of his detractors were in the stands today. arts.ttl: Calvert-Lewin scores first Leeds goal as Wolves slump to another defeat

arts.ttl: “It’s a dream come true!” – Okafor’s stunning goal sends Leeds United to Premier League 3-1 triumph over Wolves
arts.sum: Leeds United fought back from a goal down to produce a remarkable performance to beat Wolves 3-1 at Molineux earlier today, with three of their new signings getting on the scoresheet. Daniel Farke’s side conceded an early goal to Wolves, and for a side that hadn’t scored from open play in the Premier League, that […] The post “It’s a dream come true!” – Okafor’s stunning goal sends Leeds United to Premier League 3-1 triumph over Wolves appeared first on The Leeds Press.

arts.ttl: Leeds end goal drought with first-half blitz to leave sorry Wolves pointless
arts.sum: The dozens of Wolves supporters that stuck around until the final whistle on a grim afternoon in the Graham Hughes Stand, draped in sodden ponchos and exposed to the elements, was an image indicative of the mood here. For Vítor Pereira’s side, a fifth straight league defeat, this one against Leeds, for whom Noah Okafor, Anton Stach and Dominic Calvert-Lewin registered their first goals, the latter scoring for the only second time in 12 months. Wolves, jeered off at full time, remain pointless, bottom of the pile and in an ominous position. Of the five other teams to lose their opening five Premier League matches, three finished bottom, the anomaly from that pack the Crystal Palace side Roy Hodgson rescued in 2017-18 after a disastrous start under Frank de Boer.
